originalTitle: Ex-president accused of murder plot expelled from Togo to Burkina Faso
title: Ex-president accused of murder plot expelled from Togo to Burkina Faso
content: Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba has not commented on the accusations from Burkina Faso.

originalTitle: Malawi raises fuel prices by more than 40%
title: Malawi raises fuel prices by more than 40%
content: The new government is addressing fuel shortages and strengthening the budget but many are not happy.

content: Thousands of Senegal fans join the parade to celebrate Afcon champions on their return home.

title: Syrian government, SDF agree on a four-day ceasefire
content: Kurdish-led SDF accepts truce but reports continued attacks by government-allied forces, despite the agreement.

originalTitle: What’s behind Trump’s push to control Greenland?
title: What’s behind Trump’s push to control Greenland?
content: As Trump escalates threats to seize Greenland, Inuit Greenlanders reject being treated as geopolitical pawns.

title: Lyse Doucet: Trump is shaking the world order more than any president since WW2
content: Trump's demands over Greenland are a rude awakening in a moment fraught with risk.

content: The US president says it is "another in a very long line of National Security reasons why Greenland has to be acquired".

content: The move follows renewed tensions between the US and EU, as Donald Trump pushes to acquire Greenland.

title: 'Battered in Bodo' - is this more than just a blip for Man City?
content: Manchester City suffered their very own "hell of a beating" moment in Norway on Tuesday - now Pep Guardiola and his players must turn around their fortunes in an increasingly trying January.

title: Slot hints Salah will start for Liverpool in Marseille
content: Arne Slot suggests Mohamed Salah will return to the Liverpool starting line-up against Marseille in Wednesday's Champions League tie, insisting his relationship with the forward is "as normal as it's always been".

title: 'Everything is going wrong' - Guardiola on Bodo/Glimt upset
content: Pep Guardiola responds to his team's second defeat in four days as Manchester City lose at Bodo/Glimt in the Champions League.
